result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) and OWI (7th, 8th or 9th). The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th) and the other charge, OWI (7th, 8th or 9th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Paul S Treutelaar was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (7th, 8th or 9th), a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge 
Incarceration Program and IS Eligible for Substance
Abuse Program. Sentence credit of 3 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to fine, paid in full.
Reimbursement for Blood Draw costs to be paid/forwarded to Waukesha Co Clerk of Courts for Town of Mukwonago Police Dept. Cash Bail applied, paid in full.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.

**ATTEND a Victim Impact Panel meeting. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is waived. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes: Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle OPERATED, TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Paul S Treutelaar in court with Attorney Kelsey Morin.  Brian J. Juech and Law Intern Shannon Tenney appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #2.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #2.  Count #1 is dismissed by operation of law.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Morin makes statements regarding sentencing. Betty T. makes statements. Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #2:  IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

6 YEARS  IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 3 days)
  -  3 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON 

*DL REVOCATION:  36 MONTHS
*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 MONTHS

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done (Court waives surcharges)

FINE:  $2,023.00 & DNA surcharge is WAIVED (to be paid out of cash bail posted and remainder due as a condition of extended supervision)

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Town of Mukwonago Police Department   

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence. Witness list attached.

Defendant Paul S Treutelaar in court with attorney Joseph Smith.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Attorney Smith requests 45 day adjournment.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Arraignment on July 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Paul S Treutelaar in court with attorney Joseph Smith.  Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Officer Craig Ketola from the Town of Mukwonago was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. State presents exhibit #1 marked and received. Cross examination by the defense. State rests. No testimony by defense. Testimony is closed. State moves for bind over and presents arguments. Defense objects.   Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. Defense waives the 30 day time limit for the filing of the information.   Bail remains as fixed.  Review Exhibits scheduled for December 21, 2016 at 08:00 am.  Arraignment scheduled for July 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 19, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed and maintain sober.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program.   Defendant ordered to SCRAM monitoring.  Defendant to pay costs associated with SCRAM monitoring.  Defendants who can not  pay will be required to follow an enhanced level of direct supervision requirements as established by WCS.  WCS will notify the Court.  Defendant to be released directly/only to Wisconsin Community Services personnel to set-up SCRAM monitoring.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Paul S Treutelaar in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed. Defendant allowed non-collect calls.   PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 20 DAYS  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 19, 2015 at 08:15 am.
